moves.2. Nf3 d6 3. d4: I like to go after the center early, so I usually will end up pushing both e4 and d4; although I open myself up, most players don't capitalize on this opportunity
moves.3... cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6. Bg5 e: I figure my pieces are well developed for the most part, So now I'll castle. (Plus the rook will solidify my hold on the center.
moves.8... e5 9. Nf3 Bg4: Classical mechanism. Easily prevented by h3(?!) but chose not to risk opening up my king
moves.10. Be2 O-O 11. Bxf6: Things are pretty stale, I figure I'd better get some action going before one of us is bored to death. Plus, I weaken the power of the bishop on g4.
moves.11... Bxf6 12. Nd5: I'm just making myself out to be the aggressor here, and make him risk his king's position; Also delaying pawn to d5 push.
moves.12... Nc6 13. Nxf6+: Probably could have delayed this, but chose not to. It works out eventually
moves.13... Qxf6 14. Nd2: I want him to take the bishop (keep the action going, and show that I don't have to be the aggressor for the entire game). The knight adds protection to e4 pawn.
moves.14... Bxe2 15. Qxe2 Nd4: Saw this coming, but not worried
moves.16. Qd1 b5 17. Nb3: I'm purposely taking the risk of losing the e4 pawn to allow me to activate a rook. I could have done c3, but I'm a gambler, and I like to have fun as I play this game
moves.17... Nxb3 18. axb3 Rfe8 19. Rb1: Just in case he pushes d5
moves.19... b4: Now I switch from being the aggressor to the strategist.
moves.20. c3 bxc3 21. bxc3 a5 22. Re1: refortify the center just in case of a counter-strike.
moves.22... Reb8: interesting decision; trying to step up as the aggressor, let's see where this leads...
moves.23. Re3 Rb7 24. Rd3: We are trying to catch one another off guard by switching roles.
moves.26... a4 27. b5 Ra5 28. Qc1 Qd8 29. b6 R: I'm not really trying to get a 2nd queen, I'm just trying to create an open lane for the rook
moves.31... Rxb7 32. Rxb7 Qxb7 33. Rxa4 h6: possibly a wasted move? Unless he thought i would sacrifice my queen to back-rank him.
moves.34. Qc2 d5: ?:hmm...probably not wise to push this now...
moves.35. exd5: !!The better choice as Black's king is still blocked in
moves.35... Qxd5: ! interesting. Wonder if considering a rook trade?
moves.36. Rb4: Don't wanna lose a pawn in this tight game, but has bigger things in mind...
moves.36... Qd4: ?? The big mistake. Qd8 would prevent the next move and still save the queen!
moves.37. Rb8+: A well played game by both parties. 1 big mistake for black cost him. It's a shame such a wonderful game came to such a tragic end...
